fields.description:

# Create a repository in Bitbucket Cloud
## Add a file to it;
## commit the file, and;
## push it to the repository.
# Rename the file with {{git mv <oldfilename.txt> <newfilename.txt>}}
## commit the file with an issue key in the commit message;
## and push it to the repository.
# Access the issue mentioned in the commit message
# Click on the commit link in under the *Development* panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem 
Board admins can choose how much time it will take for completed issues to be removed from the Kanban board view. However, this is not based on when the issue had a resolution set, but rather on the last time the issue was updated.

h3. Suggested solution
Exclude completed issues from Kanban boards based on the resolution date, not updated date. Alternatively, allow users to choose which date to use for this.
fields.summary: Filtering out completed issues from Kanban boards will filter them based on last updated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a status is unmapped in the board config, it will not show in the sprint report. 
i.e. Issues transitioned to this status will: 
# show under the *Issues Removed From Sprint* category
# show as if they were in the last status before transitioning to the current one that's unmapped. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start sprint with issue A
# Resolve issue A
# Complete the sprint
# Go to sprint report. Issue A is listed under completed issue
# Go to column management page > un-map the Done status (to unmapped column)
# Go to the report again 

h3. Expected Results
The report shall not change
h3. Actual Results
Issue A is listed under issue removed from sprint and show the previous status it transitioned to "Done" from. 

h3. Workaround
Make all workflow statuses in the "Complete" category mapped to columns so they're considered as complete in the reports.
fields.summary: If the status is unmapped in the board configuration, any issue in this status will show as removed from sprint in the sprint report

fields.description:

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing the *Sprint Report*, issues on the *Status Report* won't display the status:
!example.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum board with four statuses and three columns:
#* Columns: Open, In Progress and Done
#* Statuses: *Open*, *In Progress*, *Done* and *Closed* (the latter two mapped to the Done column)
# Create a Sprint with three issues (e.g. *SCRUM-1*, *SCRUM-2*, *SCRUM-3*) and transition them to:
#* *SCRUM-1*: *Done*
#* *SCRUM-2*: *In Progress*
#* *SCRUM-3*: *Closed*
# Close the sprint and view the *Sprint Report*
#* At this point all statuses should be displayed correctly:
!closed_sprint.png|thumbnail!
# Transition *SCRUM-1* and *SCRUM-2* to *Closed*
# View the *Sprint Report* again
#* Now, only *SCRUM-3* should be displaying the status (*Closed*):
!after_transitioning.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
All statuses would be correctly shown.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will only display the statuses if at least one of the issues in the report are currently on that status.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when/if available
fields.summary: Sprint report doesn't show status for some issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The only Atlassian documentation covering the Sprint Health Gadget, [Using the Sprint Health Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile064/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-the-jira-agile-gadgets/using-the-sprint-health-gadget], was last revised in May 2014. The section of the document covering Scope Change is vague and leaves out multiple use cases, regarding calculating the scope change percentage.

h3. Expected Results

Since the gadget expresses scope change as a percentage (but does not provide the actual equation used), a Jira user might assume one of the simplest percentages:
{noformat}points in scope of sprint at end / points in scope at start{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The article provides no detail and clarity specifically around how scope change is calculated with this gadget. The scope change section obliquely refers customers to another related configuration factor, and a Jira 6.4 version of documentation: [Configuring Estimation and Tracking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile064/jira-agile-user-s-guide/configuring-a-board/configuring-estimation-and-tracking]. 

The documentation does not give much detail around the equation for the scope change percentage, i.e. the percentage calculated given different estimation statistics configured.

h3. Notes
See also bug ticket [JSWSERVER-15130 - Sprint Health gadget does not record scope change reliably|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15130].

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround.
fields.summary: Documentation bug: Update KB Using the Sprint Health Check Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Existing DVCS plugin in Jira software will break because of the following reason, 
 # DVCS plugin exhaustively uses Rest API version 1 of bitbucket.org however version 1 API is deprecated and is in the process of being removed. More details available [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis/]. 
 # Bitbucket.org is improving user privacy in order to be GDPR compliant. This means that the Rest API will change. These changes will break the DVCS plugin. More details are available [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-api-changes-gdpr/]. 

Jira Software should release updates to the existing versions in order to avoid breaking DVCS in production. 

bitbucket.org has provided Jira Software with a guarantee that all existing production version will continue to work up until 11 September 2019. Customers have time to upgrade DVCS until that otherwise the DVCS plugin will break past that date.

This issue only affects customers who have integration with bitbucket.org. Customers with existing integration of Github and Github enterprise don't need to upgrade. 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

 

 

 

 

 

 
{noformat}
 {noformat}
fields.summary: Changes in bitbucket.org for GDPR will break DVCS plugin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
You can find:
* Latest Jira REST API docs under: [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/latest]
* Latest Jira Service Desk REST API docs under: [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/server]

But when accessing [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/server] you get Jira Agile REST API docs for version 7.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/server]

h3. Expected Results
Latest Jira Software docs are available

h3. Actual Results
Jira Software docs for version 7.3.1 are available and there is no way to access the docs for newer version

h3. Workaround

You can view [WADL|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Application_Description_Language] - XML document containing the REST documentation. 
To do so you need to:
* setup Jira Software in version you wish to see the docs
* login
* access <JIRA_URL>/rest/agile/1.0/application.wadl
** you can replace "agile" with other Jira Software plugin's rest key

Convenient way to browse REST API is to use Atlassian unsupported plugin [Atlassian REST API Browser|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211542/atlassian-rest-api-browser]
fields.summary: Missing Jira Software REST API docs since version 7.3.2

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When an issue is deleted in a sprint, no burndown event is created. This makes it impossible to hit 0 story points in the burndown chart. The only way to get around it is to remove the issue from the sprint first or complete the issue first. 

If the issue is deleted, that sprint will be broken for the duration, as that issue cannot be brought back on the sprint, recreating it would increase sprint scope.
fields.summary: Deleting an Issue in a Sprint doesn't affect scope

fields.description:
JIRA Administrator might not want to embed the issue collector form in a page but access the form directly instead. In some cases, their website is running on HTTPS but JIRA instance is running on HTTP, embedding HTTP content in an HTTPS page will result in some users unable to see the embedded content due to browser blocking mixed content.

The following KB article details this issue and it presents a workaround by accessing a rest endpoint to open the form directly. Unfortunately, this endpoint doesn't work anymore, the HTML code for the form is returned but it stays hidden, not showing the fields to fill.
fields.summary: Issue collector mixed content issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After updating UPM to 4.0.5, the Find New Apps and Manage Apps cannot be loaded. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update UPM to 4.0.5
 # Access the Find New Apps or Manage Apps page.

h3. Expected Results
Pages are loaded succesfully.

h3. Actual Results
The UPM content is blank. 

Due to the malformed URLs being returned.

{noformat}
 "url": "https://marketplace.atlassian.comrest/2/geoip",
          "url": "https://marketplace.atlassian.comrest/2/geoip",
          "url": "https://marketplace.atlassian.comrest/2/geoip",
          "url": "https://marketplace.atlassian.comrest/2/geoip",
          "url": "https://marketplace.atlassian.comrest/2/geoip",
          "url": "https://marketplace.atlassian.comrest/2/geoip",
{noformat}
h3. Notes
Certain third-party apps are checking for countryCode from {{GET live?countryCode=}} and these calls are returning the malformed GeoIP URLs.

h3. Workaround

Manually downgrading UPM to 4.0.4 by replacing the JAR from $JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins, clear the plugin cache and delete the UPM entry from pluginversion and pluginstate tables.
fields.summary: Find New Apps and Manage Apps page cannot be loaded after updating UPM to 4.0.5

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

**When in the Backlog view, moving a Done Issue from the current Sprint and dragging it down to the Backlog (or vice versa while it is still visible before refreshing the page) causes the browser to encounter an error.  
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Jira Software 8.x
 * SCRUM project
 * Chrome, Firefox
 * Backlog view with current Sprint on top

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Drag any complete Issue (not a Sub-task) from Sprint to Backlog and the browser will encounter an error after you acknowledge the Change in Scope.
 # While the Issue is still on screen, you can drag it from Backlog to Sprint again and the same error will occur. If you refresh the screen, however, you cannot do this because the Issue is Done and it will no longer be populated in the backlog.

h3. Expected Results

The Done Issue will move from Sprint to Backlog without encountering an error.
h3. Actual Results

The browser encounters an error. 
 The Jira logs do not display an error. Only this is present in the atlassian-jira.log to indicate that an action occurred:
{code:java}
 2019-07-24 14:47:28,616 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-2 DEBUG jiraadmin 887x868x1 1i7sqdg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/rank [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] getService bundle [com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-plugin]
2019-07-24 14:47:28,804 JIRA-INFORM-Thread-0 DEBUG jiraadmin 887x868x1 1i7sqdg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/rank [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] getService bundle [com.atlassian.jira.plugins.inform.event-plugin] {code}
The below exception is thrown in the browser:

!image-2019-07-24-15-43-50-053.png!

h3. Notes

This is likely tied to the fact that Backlog isn't supposed to show Done Issues by default. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dragging a closed Issue from Sprint to Backlog produces a browser error

fields.description:
{panel}
This bug is directly related to JRASERVER-69388, but had lower impact. JRASERVER-69388 was affecting all plugins creating custom fields in the @PluginEnabledEvent. This bug is related to plugins creating custom fields (or any entities) in a com.atlassian.upgrade.spi.UpgradeTask. This is the case for JSW Development custom field.
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Jira locked Development field name shows i18n key as it is. Other entities can be affected:
 * custom field name and description (table: customfield)
 * issue type name and description (table: issuetype)
 * field configuration scheme name (table: fieldconfigscheme)
 * field configuration name (table: fieldconfiguration)
 * field layout item description (table: fieldlayoutitem)
 * project role name and description (table: projectrole)
 * search request query (table: searchrequest)

h3. Environment
 - Jira 8.2.0
 - Not reproduced 7.13.0, 8.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Build Jira with installer
 # Move _Jira Administration > Issues > Custom fields_
 # Check locked "Development" field

h3. Expected Results

Field name show "Development".
Field description show "Development Summary Field for Jira Software use only".

 !Screenshot 2019-07-23 at 16.06.39.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Field name show "devstatus.customfield.development.name".
Field description show "devstatus.customfield.development.desc".

!Screenshot 2019-07-23 at 10.56.15.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: devstatus.customfield.development keys shown instead of name and description

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On plugin development, IssueLinkCreatedEvent is fired before the Edit Issue process is completed. 

The listener is to copy a value from a custom field (*_Field A_*) of the linked issue to the linking issue. 

h3. Environment

-

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a listener: 
{code:java}
    @EventListener
    public void issueLinkCreatedEvent(IssueLinkCreatedEvent issueEvent) {
        Issue sourceIssue = issueEvent.getIssueLink().getSourceObject();
        Issue destinationIssue = issueEvent.getIssueLink().getDestinationObject();
        
        someService.copyField(sourceIssue, destinationIssue);
    }
{code}
# Create a new issue. 
# Edit the issue and link an Epic. 
# Let's say the *_Field A_* of: 
#* the linked Epic has a value of *_Value A_* and 
#* this newly-created issue has a value of *_Value B_* 
# Save the Edit Issue. 
# The listener captured the event and copy *_Value A_* from the Epic to the newly-created issue. 
(i) Note that the Edit Issue process hasn't completed yet. 
# Once the Edit Issue process completed, the *_Value B_* in the Edit Screen overwrite the *_Value A_* copied earlier by the listener. 

h3. Expected Results

The IssueLinkCreatedEvent is expected to fire *_after_* the Edit Issue process is completed. 

h3. Actual Results

The IssueLinkCreatedEvent is to fire *_before_* the Edit Issue process is completed. 
 !Screenshot 2019-07-23 at 3.02.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

-

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: IssueLinkCreatedEvent is fired before the Edit Issue process is completed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating issues from Bitbucket Server side, the Create Issue screen show fields in incorrect order.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few fields in Jira side and add them to create issue screen:
[^Jira_Bug_Create_Issue.pdf]
[^Jira_Bug_Field_Configuration.pdf]
[^Jira_Bug_Field_List.pdf]
# In Bitbucket side, open the Create Issue modal window and see that fields are displayed in incorrect order:
!BB-Create-Issue-1.png|thumbnail! 
!BB-Create-Issue-2.png|thumbnail!

h2. Issue Summary
The Jira Agile sidebar does not load the expected board for a project if the following conditions are met and instead it loads the last "visited" board by the user.

* The dark feature [As a JIRA Administrator I want to have the option to disable sidebar board loading|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16717] is enabled.

* A user clicks on the project link either from the Top Menu->Projects or from View All Projects screen

* The project's board is not in the user's history (The user has not accessed this board, hence there is no record in {{userhistoryitem}} table for that user and the specific board)
 

h2. Environment

* From Jira 7.6.9 (this is the version where the feature was implemented) to 7.6.latest or Jira 7.13.X

* With the dark feature {{com.atlassian.jira.agile.darkfeature.sidebar.boards.list.disabled}} enabled

h2. Steps to reproduce

There could be different ways to reproduce the problem, one is as described in the Summary section another way to reproduce it is as follows:

# Create a new project
# Go to the View All Projects menu

* The Jira Agile sidebar does not load the expected board for a project


h2. Expected Results
* The Jira Agile sidebar loads the expected board for a project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira's [REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/latest/], certain REST API endpoint operation such as {noformat}DELETE /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}?user=<username>{noformat} always returns {color:red}{{204 No Content}}{color}.

The response code is still the same for any of the following scenarios:

* Even if the user is actually removed from the role
* Even if the username is invalid
* Even if the user is not part of the {{projectrole}}
* Even if the DELETE call failed for any reason


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Jira user (i.e. UserName = test)
# Add them to a Project Role in any project
# Attempt to use the *+Delete Actor+* method for the  {noformat} DELETE /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}?user=<username> {noformat} endpoint to remove them from the Project Role

h3. Expected Result:

User gets separate response code pertaining the success/failure or valid/invalid username

h3. Actual Result:

User gets {color:red}{{204 No Content}}{color}
fields.summary: Add separate HTTP response codes for DELETE /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}

fields.description:
h2. Recommendation

We should include scripts used to capture thread dumps in the product installer we ship. As an admin, having these scripts available at the ready during a performance incident will provide ease of mind and ease of capture, particularly should another staff member be monitoring the instance at any given time.

When the product is unresponsive, the option to capture thread dumps inside of a support zip may not be available through the web interface.
h2. How to Capture Thread Dumps - Linux
 * [Generating A Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/generating-a-thread-dump-188095.html]

h4. Manual commands
h6. Option 1 - jstack
{panel}
 # First, identify the Process ID for Jira (referred here as the $JIRA_PID) using the command: {{ps aux | grep -i java}}
 # Using the $JIRA_PID while logged in as the user that runs Jira, run the following script in the terminal:
{code:java}
for i in $(seq 6); do top -b -H -p $JIRA_PID -n 1 > jira_cpu_usage.`date +%s`.txt; jstack $JIRA_PID > jira_threads.`date +%s`.txt; sleep 10; done
{code}
(i) *NOTE*: This will produce 12 text files in the directory from where this was run. If the 'jira_threads' files contain no data, then you will need to provide the *fully qualified path* to the *jstack* binary in the script. For example: If your *jstack* binary exists under /usr/java/bin/jstack , then the script would need to be modified as follows:
{code:java}
for i in $(seq 6); do top -b -H -p $JIRA_PID -n 1 > jira_cpu_usage.`date +%s`.txt; /usr/java/bin/jstack $JIRA_PID > jira_threads.`date +%s`.txt; sleep 10; done
{code}

 # Please, make sure to zip and attach all .txt files generated after running the commands (jira_cpu_usage and jira_threads) to the ticket.{panel}
h6. Option 2 - kill -3
{panel}
 # First, identify the Process ID for Jira (referred here as the $JIRA_PID) using the command: {{ps aux | grep -i java}}
 # Using the $JIRA_PID while logged in as the user that runs Jira, run the following script in the terminal:
{code:java}
for i in $(seq 6); do top -b -H -p $JIRA_PID -n 1 > jira_cpu_usage.`date +%s`.txt; kill -3 $JIRA_PID; sleep 10; done
{code}

 # The thread dumps will be placed in your catalina.out file
 # Zip the catalina.out and jira_cpu_usage files that are generated and upload to your ticket{panel}
h4. Bash Script
{code:java}
#!/bin/bash
#
# Thread dump script
# Captures one thread dump every 10 seconds, 6 times
# Thus, generating 6 thread dumps over the course of a minute
# Replace "jira" in the APP_NAME declaration below for different products
# This must be run as the same OS user the app runs as
# Include the full path to jstack if it reports the command is not found
# ex: JSTACK_PATH=/opt/java/jdk8u192-b12/bin/jstack

APP_NAME=jira
APP_PID=`ps aux | grep java | grep $APP_NAME | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}'`
JSTACK_PATH=jstack

echo "Please wait 60 seconds for collection to complete"

for i in $(seq 6)
        do
                echo "Recording thread dump #" ${i}
                top -b -H -p $APP_PID -n 1 > jira_cpu_usage.`date +%s`.txt
                $JSTACK_PATH $APP_PID > jira_threads.`date +%s`.txt
                sleep 10
                done

echo "Done"
{code}
h2. How to Capture Thread Dumps - Windows
 # [Download PsExec|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/bb897553.aspx] from Sysinternals
 # Unzip the *PSTools* directory to a suitable place on your server.
 # Open the unzipped *PSTools* folder, hold shift and right-click inside it, then select *Open command window here* (if you don't have the 'Open command window here' option you can run a command prompt as Administrator and navigate to the location of the PSTools folder using the command prompt)
 # Identify the PID of the java (tomcat) process using Task Manager > Processes
 # At the command prompt type {{psexec -s jstack XXXX > thread_dump_YY.log}} (where XXXX is your PID and YY is the number of the thread dumps taken to append to the name of the log file) then hit enter.
 ## If the jstack command is not recognized, you may need to enter the full path such as: {{psexec -s "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_201\bin\jstack.exe" XXXX > thread_dump_YY.log}}
 # You'll need repeat the above 5 or 6 times, about 20 or 30 seconds between each execution, changing the YY each time, for example:
{code:java}
psexec -s jstack 1234 > thread_dump_01.log
-- wait ~10 seconds
psexec -s jstack 1234 > thread_dump_02.log
-- wait ~10 seconds
psexec -s jstack 1234 > thread_dump_03.log
-- wait ~10 seconds
psexec -s jstack 1234 > thread_dump_04.log
-- wait ~10 seconds
psexec -s jstack 1234 > thread_dump_05.log
-- wait ~10 seconds
psexec -s jstack 1234 > thread_dump_06.log
{code}

 # You should now have 6 files named thread_dump_YY.log in the PSTools folder.

(i) *Note:* If you still have issues with jstack, add the full path of your Java 'bin' directory to the server's system path variable. The Java 'bin' directory is usually in {{Program Files\Java\bin\jdk<version>\bin}}. If you add this path to the system variable then you will need to restart the command prompt again for the change to be picked up and the {{jstack}} command to work.
fields.summary: Include script to capture thread dumps in the installer bundle

fields.description:
h2. Problem description
If an applinked JIRA contains a context path in its base URL, the Sprint Health Gadget will display an error if embedded in a Confluence page. This bug is similar to CONFSERVER-38277 except reversed: the problem appears for a JIRA gadget when embedded in Confluence.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.10.8 + JIRA 7.1.1. JIRA must have a context path in server.xml, for example "/foo".
# Create an applink between the two
# Add the JIRA feed to Confluence Admin > External Gadgets > Gadget Feed
# Create a page in Confluence and add the Sprint Health Gadget from JIRA
# Proceed through with the OAuth authentication process (i.e. "Login & Approve")

h2. Expected behavior
The gadget does not display any errors in Confluence

h2. Actual behavior
The gadget will display an error in a red box reflecting the context path of JIRA. For example if the context path is "/foo", it will show this on the screen:
{code}
The resource /foo/rest/webResources/1.0/resources, cannot be found.
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA Sprint Health Gadget shows "The resource /<context_path>/rest/webResources/1.0/resources, cannot be found" in a Confluence page

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA with Agile
# Connect JIRA and Confluence using an Application link
# Add the JIRA gadget feed to Confluence
# Create a page in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The preview of the gadget loads, you select the project/sprint information, and then insert the gadget into the page

h3. Actual Results
The preview of the gadget never finishes loading. No errors appear in the logs, but if you view the network requests being made you should see a 400 error.
!burndown_gadget.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Burndown gadget preview does not render, cannot be inserted into Confluence pages

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add a Sprint Health or Sprint Burndown Gadget in Confluence, an error may be encountered in the preview window.
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.6.13
 Jira 7.7.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Register the external gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf66/registering-external-gadgets-943962530.html]
 # While editing a page, insert a macro and choose the Sprint Health or Sprint Burndown gadget

h3. Expected Results

In the preview window, you will be prompted to authorize the connection.
h3. Actual Results

You will instead receive the following error:
 {{The resource /jira/rest/webResources/1.0/resources, cannot be found.}}
 You will then be prompted for the authorization to Jira and the gadget will add.
h3. Details

The trigger for this problem is the fact that *gadget* incorrectly fills form data for the *POST* request to: 
{code:java}
https://<confluence_url>/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest
{code}
In particular, *url* param is a *relative* URL, instead of being fully qualified (absolute) URL.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. This error will not stop you from adding the Macro, whether if you see the error in the UI or in a HAR file of the captured web traffic.
fields.summary: Adding Sprint Health and Sprint Burndown gadgets results in "The resource /jira/rest/webResources/1.0/resources, cannot be found" error

fields.description:
When attempting to close a sprint Jira Software reviews issues within the sprint to determine if the user has the proper permissions in order to close it. 

In larger environments this can be notoriously difficult to track down because board filters can be complex _and_ issue history is taken into account. Consider the following example:
* simple board filter, project = A, sprint id 42
* Creating an issue in project B, mistakenly select sprint 42
* Fix sprint on issue in project B

Because an issue in project B was mistakenly assigned a sprint from project A a user will now need the Manage Sprint permission in A _and_ B in order to close sprint 42. Currently the user nor the administrator will be able to determine this in the product itself.

This request is to provide a message visible to Jira administrators informing them of which projects need the 'Manage Sprint' permission in order to close a sprint and ideally why. 

h3. Notes
See further documentation for background
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/users-cannot-manage-a-sprint-start-close-etc-despite-having-the-manage-sprint-project-permission-824345392.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-manage-sprints-permission-for-advanced-cases-938847165.html
fields.summary: Inform Jira Administrators which projects require the 'Manage Sprints' project permission when a user cannot close a sprint as expected

h3. Issue Summary

If you attempt to add multiple links to an issue and one of the links is not valid, Jira will not add the other valid links.

h3. Environment

Any fresh install.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Step 1
 Add 2 valid links between two or more issues.
 # Step 2
Add an invalid link between two issues (for instance, use an inexistent issue key).

h3. Expected Results

Jira should add the valid links and disregard the invalid link.

h3. Actual Results

Jira does not add any of the links and presents an error message acknowledging that there is an invalid link.

h3. Workaround

The workaround available is to add links one by one.

Would be very nice if there was an option of atomically transfer an amount of story points from one task to another.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Velocity Chart's Commitment estimate is taken from the total estimate of the issue which was added to Sprint prior to the Sprint was started.

In Jira 7.1.0, we added the ability to reopen Sprint. However, in some scenario when the Sprint is reopened, Sprint start date is edited to an earlier date, the Velocity Chart still does not include the issue's story point as part of the Commitment estimate even though the estimate/issue was added before the Sprint was started with the new date value.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Ensure that there are at least 7 completed Sprints in Scrum board.
# Add an issue to a Sprint.
# Start the Sprint.
# Create a new issue and add an estimate.
# Move the to the new Sprint.
# Complete the Sprint and check Velocity Chart. The second issue's estimate will not be counted for the Sprint's commitment estimate.
# Reopen the Sprint.
# Edit the Sprint's start date to an earlier date than the date when the estimate/issue was added to the Sprint.
# Complete the Sprint.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Velocity Chart to use the Start/Complete date of reopened Sprint. This way when user view Velocity Chart, the report will include all the commitment/completed estimate based on the new start/complete dates of the Sprint.

h3. Workaround 

Ensure that the issue/estimate was added before the Sprint was initially started.
fields.summary: Allow Velocity Chart to use the Start/Complete date of reopened Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When creating issues in the backlog it is convenient to directly type the names at the bottom of the list but fields still need to populated in the side bar or popup dialog.

A simple example of this is having to assign versions/epics to large lists of issues by dragging them onto the filter name. A more complex example is assigning newly created issues to a component or adding labels via the sidebar.

It would greatly improve the workflow if new issues created were assigned any values in the current filter. This would include epic/version selection but also any other suitable field such as component.

A typical use case would be where several users are working on the same project but want to assign issues to different components that they are working on directly. It seems wasteful and error prone to require them to assign the component for every issue they create when it will always be required.

I acknowledge that this could partially be achieved by setting the field using a post function but it would not be nearly as flexible and is not as accessible to the average user.
fields.summary: Auto populate fields in new backlog issue according to current filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be useful to define a global permission that would allow a user or group access to read ALL statuses via the API. Currently, only statuses that the calling user has access can be read via REST via the API calls
 * [GET /rest/api/2/status|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/latest] (returns a list of all statuses)
 _and/or_
 * [GET /rest/api/2/project/\{projectIdOrKey}/statuses|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/latest] (returns all statuses in a certain project)

However, statuses are only returned that the user has permission to. This is defined by the "Browse Projects" permission.

Currently, a list of all statuses is only available by:
 * Adding the calling user or group to each permission scheme (in an enterprise Jira environment, hundreds may be present, there therefore cumbersome to edit)
_or_
 * Directly read the statuses from the database using sql:
{code:sql}
SELECT id, sequence, pname, description, iconurl, statuscategory FROM issuestatus;
{code}
fields.summary: Add a global permission to read REST issue statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Both background and foreground reindex requests fail due to a field that has more than 32766 bytes in the field.

Public KB: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/indexing-fails-due-to-immense-field-974366114.html]

h3. Environment
This affects JIRA 8.0 and above.
 In JIRA 8.0, Lucene was upgraded from 3.3 to 7.3. Lucene will now throw an exception instead of silently failing.
 See [Lucene upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/lucene-upgrade-955171970.html] for more information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Insert more than 32766 characters into an indexed field.
 # Step 2 Attempt to reindex

h3. Expected Results
The Lucene Issue index completes without error.

h3. Actual Results
The Issue reindex fails and the following error appears in the atlassian-jira.log:

{code:java}
2019-07-02 16:32:24,247 IssueIndexer:thread-9 WARN 10.x.x.x /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex!reindex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] Document contains at least one immense term in field="<fieldname>" (whose UTF8 encoding is longer than the max length 32766), all of which were skipped. Please correct the analyzer to not produce such terms. The prefix of the first immense term is: '[list of entries in the field]...', original message: bytes can be at most 32766 in length; got 32767
2019-07-02 16:32:24,248 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 WARN 10.x.x.x /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex!reindex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] Indexing failed for Issue - '<#####>'{code}

h3. Notes
Relevant links:
 [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37070593/how-to-deal-with-document-contains-at-least-one-immense-term-in-solr]
 [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-5472]
 [https://discuss.elastic.co/t/error-document-contains-at-least-one-immense-term-in-field/66486]

h3. Notes on fix:
Starting with "Fix-Version", fields that exceed this limit *will be removed* before they are committed to Jira’s Lucene index in order to prevent entire indexing operations from failing. Each such event will emit an ERROR level message to the logs, allowing plugin developers to pinpoint the offending fields. The log entry looks like this:
{noformat}
2019-09-04 20:06:24,091 IssueIndexer:thread-6 ERROR admin 1206x3196x1 ujgapq 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex!reindex.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.DocumentScrubber] A document contained a potential immense term in field customfield_10220_timeline. The field has been removed from the document.
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Fix the Lucene immense field indexing failure

h3. Issue Summary

When there more than ~60 issues in backlog, user face slowness while creating issue from the backlog.


h3. Environment

* Jira 8.X 
* Google Chrome 75.X


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create more than 60 issues in the backlog. We can use [Jira Data Generator|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] to generate the issues.
# Ensure that the 60 issues are displayed in a backlog of a board.
# Access the board where the issues are displayed, click on "Create issue" and enter the summary of the issue.
 

h3. Expected Results

* Use do not see any slowness while entering the issue summary.


h3. Actual Results

* User see noticeable slowness while entering the issue summary.


h3. Workaround

* Use a browser other than Google Chrome.

+Note+

While there's a noticeable delay in adding Summary, there's no problem creating issue from backlog with Chrome.
fields.summary: Slow issue creation with Google Chrome in backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I'd like to be able to parametrize a generic dashboard so that I could reuse the same dashboard in multiple context, avoiding to duplicate and maintain separate copies.

As an happy Postman user, I'm extensively using this concept of [environments|https://learning.getpostman.com/docs/postman/environments_and_globals/manage_environments/], and definitely see how a similar concept could improve user experience in Jira.
 In a large organization like the one I'm working in, this would allow multiple teams to unify on a central dashboard for common reporting, without having to copy and readjust multiple times, duplicating same filters with just a different root filter corresponding to scope of team ownership.

Requirements:
 * Same dashboard should be reusable using different filters specific to the environment
 * I could imagine for instance following environment variables
 ** $SCOPE$ - corresponding to a {{project = FOO AND component in (Bar, Baz)}}
 ** $TEAM$ - corresponding to {{(membersOf("ORG"), extrauser)}}
 ** $BASEFILTER$ - corresponding to {{$TEAM$ OR project = TOO}}
 ** ...
 * There should be a way to configure those environments and change context while looking at a dashboard. Execution of the gadgets should react to this environment and substitute variables
 * Environments should be shareable (similar to what we now can do with filter - who can view/edit)
 * There should be a way to have sticky links to those dashboards with a given environment as context, for instance [https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=123&env=456]
fields.summary: Environment-aware / parametrized dashboards

The new Jira frontend does not currently have the option to set new comments to be "Developer" only (Or other groups), this feature is extensively used in our organization to document technical solutions and/or request feedback from other developers on said solution without it being visible by our clients who maintain the state of an issue.

 

At this moment any such comments are visible and can cause misunderstandings leading to time lost explaining technical solutions and/or documentation to those it's not intended for.

 

I'd like to request this feature to be added to the new Jira frontend, as it plays a vital part in the way we communicate with eachother within Jira.
fields.summary: Missing "Developer Comment" feature in new frontend

When viewing the Sprint drop down on an Issue page, the text  in parenthesis is impossible to see.

h3. Problem Definition
When there is a workflow that is using an invalid status, the Board's configuration will turn out blank. This is a bug reported in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13881

In order to identify the responsible workflow so that the invalid status can be removed is a difficult process and is not practical. There is a need for a better way.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Include the responsible/affected workflow in the log stack trace when opening the Board's configuration
* Provide a REST API or a way to run an Integrity check for a workflow with an invalid issue status
 
h3. Workaround 
As of now, the KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Internal+Server+Error+when+accessing+Rapid+board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Jira Software 8 versions, when looking at a Scrum backlog, say with 60 or a lot more issues, trying to print the entire list of issues a browser like chrome or firefox will only show a single page of results.  The rest appear to be getting truncated off the page, with no 2nd page to print.
h3. Environment

Confirmed behavior in 8.1.0 and 8.2.2, but unable to replicated in 7.13.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board with 60 or so issues in the backlog and across planned sprints
 # on the backlog page, try to print this page in your browser

h3. Expected Results

The output of the browser print pages/preview should allow the print job to scale to use multiple pages if need be to display the contents of the entire page.
h3. Actual Results
Only one page is offered to be printed by the browser.  If not all the issues on the board can be seen on the first page, the rest cannot be printed in that view


h3. Notes
Possibly a warranty bug to Jira 8 as this function works as expected in 7.13.1

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
There is not a work-around for this specific view yet.  A work-around will be added if found.

One possible alternative is to use the Board -> Print card option to get a list of all these issues that appear here, but this output is slightly different.
fields.summary: Trying to print an agile board with lots of issues limits the output to one page only

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The columns of the Kanban board is messed up (subtask assignee view) and the assignee is not able to drag&drop the issues to the correct column within the board.  
  
Keywords: Kanban cards spanning, stretching, distorting through multiple columns statuses.

h3. Environment
JIRA 8.1.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# There are two users involved
#* User 1 - the admin user who executes the operation and is a member of Group1 security level.
#* User 2 - not a member of Group 1 security level, current assignee of the subtask
# There's one security level called Group 1 which is the default security level when the issues are created.
# The User 1 (admin) created a task (ABC-1) which automatically has a security level 1 then created a subtask (ABC-2) which the admin user assigned to User 2 (not a member of Group 1 security level)
# As User 1 (admin), I viewed the Kanban board and the columns are all intact
!admin-view.png|thumbnail!
# I then login as User 2 (assignee of the subtask) but the Kanban board's columns have no more partition and doesn't allow the assignee to drag the issues in the columns without partition
!assignee1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The columns have partitions.


h3. Actual Results
Column partitions are not respected in Assignee's view (subtask).

h3. Workaround
Remove the security level on the parent issue and refresh the board (subtask assignee's view).

h3. Note
The issue is not reproducible in JIRA 7.0.10 and 7.13.4. One thing that I noticed is that since the User 2 has no visibility with the parent task (due to security level), he's not able to view it in the board unlike with 8.1.0.
fields.summary: Column Formatting of the Kanban board is gone in Subtask's Assignee view

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* Jira Software 8.2
* Fisheye / Crucible 4.7.0
* Bitbucket 6.3.2

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install and connect Jira, Bibtucket and Fisheye
# Connect Bitbucket's repository to Fecru according to [Setting up a Git repository in Crucible|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crucible/setting-up-a-git-repository-in-crucible-298977505.html]
# In your checked-out code, create a branch and push it to Bitbucket
#* At this point, Jira should show only one Branch (from Bibtucket)
# Add a file to the repository, commit it and push it to the branch
#* Jira should then display 2 branches (one from "Fisheye / Crucible" and one from "Bitbucket Server")
# Then, checkout a different branch locally, and delete the branch used previously from local and remote
#* In Jira, the Development panel will show *1 branch*, but clicking it will show ??{color:grey}You don't have access to view all related branches. Please contact your administrator.{color}??

h3. Expected Behavior
Jira should not display any branches on the related issues

h3. Actual Behavior
Jira still shows *1 branch*, but clicking on it shows:
bq. You don't have access to view all related branches. Please contact your administrator.

h3. Notes
* The repository in Fecru correctly doesn't display the branch information immediately after it's removed
* Reindexing the repository in Fecru will remove the references to the commited file, but will not impact Jira
* In Jira's database we can see:
{code:SQL| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
WITH applinks AS (SELECT SUBSTR(a.property_key,16,36) as "appkey", b.propertyvalue as "appname" FROM propertyentry a join propertystring b on a.id=b.id where a.property_key like 'applinks.admin%name')

SELECT a.appname, s."UPDATED", s."JSON" FROM "AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY" s 
JOIN applinks a ON a.appkey = s."PROVIDER_SOURCE_ID"
WHERE "JSON" like '%SCRUM-28%';
{code}
{noformat}
  appname  |         UPDATED         |                                                                                                                                            JSON
-----------+-------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 FeCru     | 2019-06-26 10:32:08.512 | {"value":{"targets":{"SCRUM-28":[{"type":{"id":"repository"},"objects":[]},{"type":{"id":"review"},"objects":[]},{"type":{"id":"branch"},"objects":[{"lastUpdated":"2019-06-26T10:30:54.000+0200","count":1,"branches":["feature/SCRUM-28-create-song"]}]}]}},"expiry":9223371721494775807}
 Bitbucket | 2019-06-26 10:35:02.405 | {"value":{"targets":{"SCRUM-28":[{"type":{"id":"repository"},"objects":[]},{"type":{"id":"branch"},"objects":[]},{"type":{"id":"pullrequest"},"objects":[]}]}},"expiry":9223371721494775807}
(2 rows)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing a branch in Bitbucket causes the Development Panel to still show a branch if connected to Fisheye / Crucible

h3. Problem Definition

In Jira 8.1, [As a user I would like to resize the Detail View in Work mode|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9236] feature was introduced to allow users to resize the issue detail view.

If the board is configured with 5-6 columns and the issue detail view is resized, part of the Column view will be hidden. Some users would like to content in the whole columns to viewable in board view without the need for scrolling.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the content of the board (columns) to be rendered within board sidebar and issue detail view dynamically. This way, when the issue detail view is resized, the column view will be resized as well to prevent part of the column view from being hidden.


h3. Workaround 

Disable the resizeable issue detail function by adding *com.atlassian.jira.agile.darkfeature.flexible.boards.disabled* feature flaf in dark feature page. To do this, refer to the documentation below:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to use a Jira Software Server to connect to a Bitbucket Cloud site using the DVCS, users are unable to complete this integration. The Bitbucket Cloud recently deprecated all v1 rest api endpoints per [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis/]
 Which in turn is generating errors for Jira Admins trying to complete this process.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Server 7.12.1
 * Bitbucket Cloud (all BB Cloud sites by June 30, some sites already have deprecated this)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Follow steps in [Connect Bitbucket Cloud to Jira Software Server - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/connect-bitbucket-cloud-to-jira-software-server-814208991.html]
 # In step #2 when trying to complete integration from Jira

h3. Expected Results

integration is successful
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
{"type": "error", "error": {"message": "Resource removed", "detail": "This API is no longer supported.\n\nFor information about its removal, please refer to the deprecation notice at: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis/ "}}
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Bitbucket Cloud API rest APIs are changing due to GDPR regulations and personal data protection. The DVCS plugin has an exemption to these API changes, however this issue is caused by a bug in the exemption logic in Bitbucket Cloud. They are aware of the problem, and already have a fix for it. This fix was deployed EOD 21 June 2019 PDT (/).

Jira versions: 7.6.13, 7.13.3, 7.13.4, 8.0.0, 8.0.2, 8.1.0, 8.2.0, 8.2.1, 8.2.2 are impacted; all other Jira Software versions the integration with Bitbucket Cloud will work.

This does not impact Github and Github Enterprise integration.

Additionally, we are working on an updated version of the DVCS plugin that will be compatible with the new API from Bitbucket Cloud. It should be available in early July.
h3. Workaround

No current workaround
fields.summary: DVCS in Jira Software is unable to use Bitbucket Cloud REST API v1 which has been deprecated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Using Greater Than Or Smaller Than (comparison operator) In JQL Search, It Return Results Like >= or <=

h3. Environment
JIRA 8.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Run below JQL Query:-
{code}project in ("JIRA") AND  (fixVersion > 8.0.0 and fixVersion <= 8.1.0){code}

h3. Expected Results
Return issue with fixed version after 8.0.0 to 8.1.0. JIRA fixed in 8.0.0 shouldn't show.
(i) Assuming the fixed version was with only 1 fixed version.

h3. Actual Results
Results returned JIRA 8.0.0 as well

h3. Workaround
Write JQL with 1 version after the version you doesn't wish to show such as:-
{code}project in ("JIRA") AND  (fixVersion > 8.0.1 and fixVersion <= 8.1.0){code}
fields.summary: When Using Greater Than Or Smaller Than (comparison operator) In JQL Search, It Return Results Like >= or <=

fields.description:
As a user I want text values in saved searches to update if a project/system admin changes the value.

Currently if a project/system admin changes a text value (e.g. sprint, component, status, resolution, etc.), then all the saved searches for every user instantly become redundant/incorrect. This breaks everything based on saved search results - dashboards, boards, reporting, etc. The longer a text value is in the system, the more wide spread the impact if it were changed or deprecated and replaced.

 

In a similar way to how Excel updates cell references in formulas when cells are moved, it would be awesome if text values in saved searches were updated to match the new text value if the value is changed. Some form of ID tracking would need to be involved to link the text in the saved search to the values stored for the field in the search.

I realise this is quite a technical challenge, but the benefits in terms of freedom this would give admins and users to improve their workflows, naming conventions, etc. would be huge.
fields.summary: Update text values in saved searches if the field's text value changes

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-16523].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition
JQL does not have a means for users to be able to search for which issues have been added or removed from a sprint. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a new JQL function that can do this natively

h3. Why this is important
It would help identify these issues in searches, but also then could be very useful on board say as a quick filter to see very fast which issues were added after the start of a sprint.

h3. Workaround 
This is something that 3rd party plugins have already achieved, such as Scriptrunner in https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/jql-functions.html#_addedaftersprintstart


h3. Original description:
It could be useful to be able to search for issues that were added or removed from a sprint during it's progress.

A customer even tried to get help from Script Runner support, but the according to the support, the respective function that could return that result is available only to the Server version of Script Runner.

It would be great to have it built natively.
fields.summary: JQL search for issues added and removed from a sprint

fields.description:
*As of right now:*
 * The only way to edit the interval of the DVCS sync is via a direct [DB query|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-interval-or-schedule-of-the-dvcs-repositories-sync-962980024.html], this also holds true for setting the next run time, which you have to do in order to not auto sync any repo or org you've added.
 * Currently adding an Org requires you to do an initial sync of the repo in order for PRs and commits work, this injects the webhooks into GH(E) BUT:
 * In order to disable auto-syncing for PRs you have to add the dvcs.connector.pr-synchronization.disabled dark feature, which also disables the webhooks syncs, as adding an org or repo will sync all the PRs, commits etc.
 * It would be nice to add these directly to the GUI or allow partial syncs for only certain repositories.
 * It would also be nice to be able to use the dvcs.connector.pr-synchronization.disabled and still be able to get PRs via webhooks
fields.summary: Addition of more robust DVCS sync options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user selects Swimlane option of "Other Issues" or "Everything Else" and return to board view, they will see:

"Other Issues" as "gh.rapid.swimlane.parentchild.default.name"
"Everything Else" as "gh.issue.noassignee"

 !Screenshot 2019-06-06 at 5.45.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screenshot 2019-06-06 at 5.45.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment

Only affects Jira 8.2.X.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a board.
# Create a Sprint
# Create some Stories and under some of the Stories, create subtasks.
# Add the Stories to the Sprint and start the Sprint.
# Switch the swimlane option to Assignee and go back to board. For unassigned issues, Jira will group it under "gh.issue.noassignee"
# Switch the swimlane option to Stories and go back to board. For Stories without subtask, Jira will group it under "gh.rapid.swimlane.parentchild.default.name"


h3. Expected Results

# When swimlane option of Assignee is chosen, Jira should group the unassigned issue under "Everything Else"
# When swimlane option of Stories is chosen, Jira should group the unassigned issue under "Other Issues"


h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Board displaying incorrect name for "Other Issues" and "Everything Else"

fields.description:
There are two ways, that I know of, how to restrict the amount of fields shown for bulk operations. 

1. Custom Field Context
 * Configure each Custom field only for the project context it is applicable for

2. Field Configuration Scheme
 * Hide not wanted fields in the configuration scheme

The problem with the 1st option is that when you create a new project you always have to adjust the context of each field you want to use. 

The 2nd option is the option of my choice because it "adjust" automatically. The problem here is that once a new custom field is created the custom field is automatically added to the existing field configurations as shown. 

The suggestion is: Please add those fields as hidden, so that the people can make it visible if needed but do not have to hide all fields once in a while.
fields.summary: Hide new custom fields in already existing custom field configurations
